derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin infect- 'tainted', from the verb inficere, from in- 'into' + facere 'put, do'

entry.def: To infect people, animals, or plants means to cause them to have a disease or illness.

example.ex: A single mosquito can infect a large number of people.
example.tran: 一只蚊子就可以感染很多人。
被感染者使用过的物品

entry.def: To infect a substance or area means to cause it to contain harmful germs or bacteria.

example.ex: ...a virus which is spread mainly by infected blood.
example.tran: 主要通过被污染的血液传播的病毒

entry.def: When people, places, or things are infected by a feeling or influence, it spreads to them.

example.ex: For an instant I was infected by her fear...
example.tran: 有那么一会儿她的恐惧也传染给了我。

example.ex: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas...
example.tran: 他认为他们可以用他们的资产阶级思想去影响别人。

entry.def: If a virus infects a computer, it affects the computer by damaging or destroying programs.

example.ex: This virus infected thousands of computers within days.
example.tran: 这种病毒在短短几天内感染了数千台计算机。

sentences.sentence: "Your children have infected you with this head cold"

means.word_mean: 2. contaminate with a disease or microorganism
3. contaminate with ideas or an ideology;

sentences.sentence: "His laughter infects everyone who is in the same room"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 受到影响的,不自然的,假装的
stems_affixes.word_buile: affect[v.影响;[疾病]侵袭;感动 n.情感,感情]+ed……的→被影响的
affection[n.爱,喜爱;爱慕之情;感情;疾病,不适]+ate……的→adj.挚爱的,充满感情的
affect情感+ive……的→adj.情感的,表达感情的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有效的,生效的;被实施的;给人深刻印象
stems_affixes.word_buile: effect[n.结果;效果;影响;印象 v.招致;实现;达到]+ive……的→adj.有效的,生效的;被实施的;给人深刻印象

stems_affixes.value_cn: 传染的,传染性的,有感染力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: infect传染+ious……的→adj.传染的,传染性的,有感染力的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 完善的;完全的;[语法]完成的
stems_affixes.word_buile: per全部+fect做,制作→全部做完→完善的
disaffect[v.使不满意,使疏远]+ed……的→adj.[政治上]不满的,叛离的
af使+fect做,制作→使……做→影响

stems_affixes.value_cn: 爱,喜爱;爱慕之情;感情;疾病,不适
stems_affixes.word_buile: affect[v.影响;[疾病]侵袭;感动 n.情感,感情]+ion表名词→n.爱,喜爱;爱慕之情;感情;疾病,不适
con共同+fect做,制作→很多[果子,甜品]加在一起做→调制[出糖果]
confect[v.调制,n.西点,糖果]+ion某种物→n.甜食,糖果

stems_affixes.value_cn: 糖果制造人, 糖果店
stems_affixes.word_buile: confection[n.甜食,糖果]+ery场所→n.糖果制造人, 糖果店
de坏+fect做,制作→做坏了→缺陷
de坏+fect做+ion表名词→做坏事
affect感动+ation表名词→做出的感动→做作
ef出+fect做,制作→做出来→出效果
infect[v.传染,感染;影响[思想等]]+ion状态→n.感染,传染;传染病
perfect[adj.完善的;完全的;[语法]完成的 v.使完美]+ion表名词→n.尽善尽美,完美
af使+fect做,制作→使……做→影响
con共同+fect做,制作→很多[果子,甜品]加在一起做→调制[出糖果]
dis分开+affect感情→感情分开→疏远
ef出+fect做,制作→做出来→出效果
effect[n.结果;效果;影响;印象 v.招致;实现;达到]+u+ate表动词→v.实行,完成
in进入+fect做,制作→做进去→传染进去
per全部+fect做,制作→全部做完→完善的

Sentence.sentence: Ebola was so deadly and killed so quickly that within a short period of time, there was no one around to infect.
The Sudan version was deadly enough, killing 50% of those it infected.
If the virus had been capable of spreading through the air, or if one infected person had unknowingly entered a large population center, Ebola might have become a worldwide epidemic

sentences.cn: 尘土会使敞露的伤口受到感染。

sentences.en: Whole societies become infected by these vices.
sentences.cn: 整个社会都被这些恶习所腐蚀。

sentences.en: Mary's high spirits infected all the girls in the class.
sentences.cn: 玛丽的兴致感染了全班的女孩。

jushi.english: I didn't pay attention to it because I never infected.
jushi.chinese: 我对它根本不注意,因为我从不受传染。

jushi.english: The whole room was infected by the smell of coal.
I didn't pay attention to it because I am never infected.
jushi.chinese: 我对它根本不注意,因为我从不受传染。
